article.name: Integrate Mirage with Your KSAT Console
article.title: Integrate Mirage with Your KSAT Console
article.body:
You can integrate your Mirage platform into your KSAT console. Mirage is an AI-driven social engineering platform that allows you to protect your organization through vishing (voice phishing) simulations, training, and mobile-based mitigation. You can sync Mirage simulation events directly into your KSAT console for reporting, training, and targeting purposes.

Before You Connect Mirage to Your KSAT Console

Before integrating Mirage into your KSAT console, you must find your API address and create a User Event API key. Follow the steps below to do both actions.

  1. Your API address depends on where your KnowBe4 account is located. Please see the table below to find the API address for your region.
    Region Base URL
    US https://us.api.knowbe4.com
    CA https://ca.api.knowbe4.com
    EU

    https://eu.api.knowbe4.com
    UK

    https://uk.api.knowbe4.com
    DE

    https://de.api.knowbe4.com
  2. Log into your KSAT console as an admin.
  3. Navigate to Account Settings in the top-right corner under your account’s email address.
  4. In Account Settings, navigate to Account Integrations.
  5. Under Account Integrations, navigate to API > User Event API.
  6. Give your User Event API key a name and click the Create API Key button. Your API key will appear.

  7. Please save this API key for the below steps.

Connecting Mirage to Your KSAT Console

You can connect your Mirage platform to your KSAT console by following the steps below.

  1. Log into your Mirage platform as an admin.
  2. Navigate to Org. Settings.
  3. Scroll down to the bottom of the page to navigate to KnowBe4 User Events.
  4. Select the region that matches your base URL in the Region drop-down menu
  5. Enter the User Event API key from the previous steps in the API Key field.
  6. Click Save.

Using Mirage Events to Create Smart Groups

When you have completed setting up the Mirage integration, you will begin to receive events from the platform:

With these events from Mirage, you can set up Smart Groups and automate additional activities in KSAT:

images.alt:
This technical description details the API key management interface for the KnowBe4 platform.

**Interface Overview:**
The screen is titled **"KnowBe4 APIs"** and includes a top navigation link, **"← Back to Account Settings"**. The interface employs a hierarchical tab structure for API access and configuration.

**Navigation Hierarchy:**

1.  **Primary API Tabs:** Define the API scope.
    *   **Reporting API** (Active)
    *   User Event API
    *   Product API
2.  **Contextual Documentation:** A link to **Reference Documentation** is present beneath the primary tabs.
3.  **Secondary Content Tabs (Active within the Reporting API):**
    *   Call History
    *   Stats
    *   **API Key** (Active)

**Content Area: API Key Creation and Management:**

1.  **Key Creation Form:**
    *   An input field is provided, labeled **"Name"**. The field is pre-filled with the example value **"mirage-token"**.
    *   A primary blue action button is available: **"Create API Key"**.

2.  **API Key Data Grid:**
    *   A data grid structure lists existing keys under three columns: **Key (?)**, **Name**, and **Actions**. (The question mark icon indicates contextual help regarding the key field.)
    *   One existing key entry is visible:
        *   Key: (Blurred for security)
        *   Name: **mirage-test**
        *   Actions: Represented by a downward chevron icon (indicating a configuration or deletion menu).

The image displays a configuration panel titled **"KnowBe4 User Events,"** with the context instruction, **"Send simulation events to KnowBe4."**

The panel contains two required input fields:

1.  **Region (4):** A dropdown selector labeled **"Region"** with the placeholder text **"Select Region."** The accompanying helper text is **"Select the region where your KnowBe4 account is hosted."**
2.  **API Key (5):** A standard text input field labeled **"API Key"** with the placeholder text **"Enter API Key."**

At the bottom of the form are two action buttons (6): a secondary button labeled **"Discard"** (outline style) and a primary, dark blue button labeled **"Save."**

The image displays a segment of an activity log or timeline interface, showing two sequential `SCORING_RESULT` events, each presented in a standardized block format.

**UI Structure:**
Each event block is preceded by a vertical timeline indicator with a purple directional arrow. The header bar is lavender and contains the event type (`SCORING_RESULT`) left-aligned, and the timestamp (`09/25/2025, 1:51 PM EDT`) right-aligned.

**Event 1 Details (Top):**
*   **Campaign ID:** 86[Obfuscated Data]
*   **Risk Data:** `cc8 Risk severity level: High (3)`
*   **Scoring Label:** `Website Credential Capture` (followed by a delete/trash can icon)
*   **Source:** `Mirage Security (572 [Obfuscated ID])`

**Event 2 Details (Bottom):**
*   **Campaign ID:** 861[Obfuscated Data]
*   **Risk Data:** `cc8 Risk severity level: Moderate (4)`
*   **Scoring Label:** `Email Link Click` (followed by a delete/trash can icon)
*   **Source:** `Mirage Security (e4 [Obfuscated ID])`

Both events share the exact same timestamp, indicating they occurred simultaneously or were logged at the same time. The structure confirms the system records scoring results tied to specific campaign IDs, assigns a severity level (text and numeric), and provides a contextual scoring label and originating source.
images.context: the Mirage integration, you will begin to receive events from the platform:

images.alt:
The image displays a modal window titled "Custom Event" overlaid on a user management interface. This modal is used for defining an event-based rule.

**UI Elements and Configuration Details:**

1.  **Rule Summary:** At the top, the dynamic rule summary reads: "User must have the specified SCORING\_RESULT event type more than 0 times in the last 3 months."
2.  **Configuration Fields:**
    *   **Condition:** Dropdown, set to "Must."
    *   **Event Type:** Dropdown, set to "SCORING\_RESULT."
    *   **Description:** Input field, set to "High."
    *   **Matcher:** Dropdown, set to "Greater Than."
    *   **Count:** Stepper input field, set to "0."
3.  **Time Frame Section:**
    *   **Selection:** The "Duration" tab is actively selected (darkened), alongside unselected "Range" and "Any" options.
    *   **Duration Configuration:** The rule is set to trigger "In the last" duration, defined using a stepper input set to "3" with the unit "Months" selected in a dropdown.
4.  **Action Buttons:** The modal footer contains "Cancel" (gray) and "Save" (blue) buttons.

**Background Context:**

The background partially visible interface displays a "Users" list showing "2 users," with the status set to "Active." The user list contains columns including a checkbox, "User," and related metrics (e.g., "Risk").
